page.title: 16Rural Information Systems
page.content: In Great and Litle Raveley and Wistow mobile libraries are welcome visitors, calling once a month, they bring leisure reading and information. Television is part of most homes, giving access to local and national information. If the television is equipped with a Teletext facility information is available from the CEEFAX and ORACLE data bases. Local and national radio networks give a comprehensive coverage of information, current affairs and music. There are a few households in the area that have their own micro-computors, used for business and leisure activities. The Royal Mail operate a postal service, delivering daily, except Sunday, thus allowing for information to be gained by correspondence, plus news of a personal nature. The telephone is also a valuable source of information.
